page.title: 13Village shopping.
page.content: The growth of Stansted Mountfitchet has meant that there are now two shopping areas.Both centres are on the old part of the village, one based in Chapel Hill and Lower Street and the other alongside Cambridge Rd (B1383). The size of the shopping catchment area is fairly small because of the nearness of the village to the 'urban centres' at Bishop's Stortford and Harlow to the south. Although facilities include a new {'shopping precinct'}for day to day needs of the community, many residents prefer to make a weekly visit to the nearest town because of the ease of access and private transport which has now had the effect of reducing the importance of the village shopping centres despite the increase of population over the past decade.
